name: Doğa Hipostazı
desc:
Code Name: Zayin. A high-purity Dendro entity.
According to the deductions of some researchers, Elemental Hypostases have the knowledge required to "learn," which is how they use "mimesis" to initiate attacks. However, the ability to incorporate information to create change also opens one to the risk of information contamination. As this creature learns and changes, the purpose of its birth - no matter how academically unquantifiable it may still be - may yet become so distorted as to be rendered irrelevant.

dropMaterial.name: Ezici Sarmaşık
dropMaterial.desc:
The final coalesced form of the Dendro Hypostasis. The tough vines protect a pure cubic elemental crystal.

Dendro defies any common logic yet exists in perfect harmony with life. Elemental Hypostases, on the contrary, are most distant in appearance to all living beings. The combination of these two should probably never have appeared in this world. It is said that such elemental hypostases have the intelligence to "learn" and have thus understood the colors and dreams of the forest, a process that has transformed them into this shape over thousands of years.

dropMaterial.name: Nagadus Zümrüdü Kırıntısı
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension Material.

"I had a very, very long dream..."

dropMaterial.name: Nagadus Zümrüdü Parçası
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension Material.

"I had a very, very long dream..."

"In it, people were holding hands, dancing in a circle, be they sages or fools, dancers or warriors, puppets or statues of gods..."

dropMaterial.name: Nagadus Zümrüdü Külçesi
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension Material.

"I had a very, very long dream..."

"In it, people were holding hands, dancing in a circle, be they sages or fools, dancers or warriors, puppets or statues of gods..."

"That dancing circle embodied everything about the universe. Life has always been the end, while it is wisdom that shall be the means."

value.text: A hypostasis that uses an inert shell to defend itself. It now displays abnormalities due to having been corrupted by some unknown influence. You must seize moments where its elemental core is exposed to attack effectively. When it is in danger, it will release Restorative Piths that have the properties of Tri-Lakshana Creatures. Use <color=#ffe14b>Dendro</color> to revive these Piths and induce a Normal State in them to continuously cleanse the Dendro Hypostasis, and use <color=#ffe14b>Electro</color> to trigger their Activated state and speed up the cleansing process. Using Dendro attacks on the Dendro Hypostasis' core can also help to cleanse the creature. <color=#ffe14b>Complete the cleansing process</color> to complete the challenge.

customize.text: This enemy is located at south of Dar al-Shifa.

Elemental Core
The elemental core of Dendro Hypostasis is always in <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> when exposed.
Recommended Party
It is a must to include at least 1 <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> character.
Dendro Hypostasis spawns 4 vines from the ground, dealing <color=#99ff88>AoE Dendro DMG</color> in a small area.
Throughout the attack, <color=#ffe14b>the elemental core is exposed</color> .

Dendro Hypostasis releases 3 series of bullets that dealing <color=#99ff88>AoE Dendro DMG</color> , and leaving residuals on the area that dealing <color=#99ff88>Dendro DMG</color> every second to character standing on it.
After the attack, <color=#ffe14b>the elemental core will be exposed</color> .

Dendro Hypostasis covers itself with vines, and plunges down into character's location 3 times, dealing <color=#99ff88>AoE Dendro DMG</color> .
Using <color=#ff9999>Pyro</color> on the vines can interrupt the attack and <color=#ffe14b>expose the elemental core</color> .

Dendro Hypostasis becomes whip-like, and attacks 3 times dealing <color=#99ff88>AoE Dendro DMG</color> .
After the attack, <color=#ffe14b>the elemental core will be exposed</color> .

Dendro Hypostasis teleports to the center of the area, and starts to charge its power.
During the charge, vines grow and surround the area 3 times, making the center area progressively narrower.
After the charge, Dendro Hypostasis release the power dealing <color=#99ff88>AoE Dendro DMG</color> .
Throughout the attack, <color=#ffe14b>the elemental core is exposed</color> .

<color=#ffe14b>When HP is low</color> , Dendro Hypostasis teleports to the center of the area, and <color=#ffe14b>releases 3 Restorative Piths</color> .
Restorative Piths can be revived by <color=#99ff88>Dendro</color> , and activated by <color=#ffacff>Electro</color> after revival.
Activated Piths boosts the cleansing process more than Revived Piths.
